definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: The tradeoff is that you take nonlethal damage when you invoke it.
sentences.chinese: 代价是你使用的时候会不停受到淤伤。

sentences.english: The increase of gross price level is the sacrifice a country makes for exercizing its function.
sentences.chinese: 价格总水平的上涨是国家为实现其职能所付出的代价。

sentences.english: His boasting cost him his life,after all.
sentences.chinese: 他的吹嘘最终以他的生命为代价。

sentences.english: Kratos: You will pay for this Zeus, be certain of that.
sentences.chinese: 你将会为此付出代价的，宙斯，我保证。

sentences.english: The cost of non-compliance with industry regulations can be catastrophic.
sentences.chinese: 对于不符合工业规则的代价可能是毁灭性的。

sentences.english: One consequence of this is a reduction in the GHG cost of production per kilo of product.
sentences.chinese: 一个结果是生产每公斤产品的温室气体代价的减少。

sentences.english: All this may be the price we pay for progress.
sentences.chinese: 这一切都可能是我们为进步付出的代价。

sentences.english: But the price for such solidarity will be very high.
sentences.chinese: 但毫无疑问这种团结的代价将无比高昂。

sentences.english: The general swore to take back this island whatever the cost.
sentences.chinese: 我位将军发誓不惜任何代价夺回这个岛。

sentences.english: She pledged to complete her father’s unfinished task, whatever the cost.
sentences.chinese: 她立誓不管付出多大代价也要完成其父的未竟事业。

sentences.english: It has been rather costly to install the machinery, but it should pay off in the long run.
sentences.chinese: 安装这套机械代价很高，但从长远来看它会赚钱的。

sentences.english: Indeed, monetary easing appeared to be costless .
sentences.chinese: 确实，放松货币似乎毫无代价。

sentences.english: There is a price crusaders need to pay for their military misadventures.
sentences.chinese: 这是十字军为自己的军事冒险付出的代价。

sentences.english: This is both contagious and deadly and must be avoided at all costs.
sentences.chinese: 这会传染且是致命的，必须不惜一切代价加以避免。

sentences.english: Now, the costs of devaluing appear prohibitively high.
sentences.chinese: 现在，贬值货币的代价看起来高得让人望而怯步。

sentences.english: There is no doubt thmight the increottom in dema particulard caused the rise in prices.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，需求的增加招致了代价的上涨。

definition: to pay/to invest (energy or time in a friendship etc)
to obtain (sth) in exchange/to exchange (sth) for (sth else)
to sacrifice one's life/to sacrifice (sth valued)/beast slaughtered as a sacrifice
not stint/not spare/not hesitate (to do sth)/not scruple (to do sth)
whatever the case/in any event/no matter what/by all possible means
to pay for sth with the loss of (one's health etc)/to have sth come at the cost of (one's reputation etc)
